020094.question: What are some cool ways you can substitute an 11th chord into a progression? I get you can incorporate them however you want into your own writing... but what about when playing with others? For example, if the chart of a song has a IV chord, would a I11 chord work over the IV in most situations? If you throw a major 6th into a I11 chord, that would esssentially make it a IVmaj9.
020094.answer: i would recommend focusing on the melody where i come from, "11" usually only is used on minor chords. i don't quite see how your example adds up. in C assuming you mean 1,3,5,7,9,11 (which mostly no one would do, i'm not sure if you meant#11? or is it a minor chord all along?) and then you add a 6, that doesn't really make Fmaj9. anyway, it's not too good to think about it this way. just use the notes you need to support the melody, then afterwards you can argue about what to put on the page. Sounds like you are a bit goal oriented on using the number 11 on the page, and that might not be a good way to look at it. A useful example of something that might end up being called "11" is let's say it's the key of C, melody note is G, and it's a Dmin7 chord. in reality you might play C,F,G(notes) in the chord, and call it Dmin11 if you want. Or let's say you are in the key of Cmin and it's just a Cmin vamp for a while and you've got a melody that is focusing on the F note. then you might use F,D,Bb notes in your chord, with the Eb tucked in there too. or more likely even, oscilating between a Bb triad and Eb triad in the chord. similarly in the relative major version of that, in the key of Eb, you might see a F note on a Cmin chord, and the chordal player will play Bb triad (over C) first, before swicthing to the Eb triad (Cmin7). all these things might be called 11. but to be honest it's not too necessary to really use the number 11 when talking about chords, it's kind of confusing, and the way it's taught as a stack of 3rds up to 11 is a bit confusing and does not really represent most musical realities. because a full stack up to 11 would have 6 notes, and most chords have less than 6 notes, so most chords being called '11' wont really have all the notes. also stacking it from the bottom up is not something that normally happens in reality outside of a music textbook or class. usually when you see 11 on the page it just means that the melody note is a 4th above the bass. and the remaining notes are chosen sensibly for the situation. i hope that makes sense

020143.question: what was going on during the time when you posted all of the videos about not having any videos?
020143.answer: my vine audience was hooked on daily videos, when i actually had only been making 2 a week. this was possible because when i first started getting popular on vine around may 2015, i still had about 100 videos made that hadn't yet been posted on the vine channel. so throughout may, june, july, all i had to do was convert 1 video per day into vine format, and post it. i was only making 2 new ones per week, but i was converting 7 old ones per week and posting them to vine. because i was posting them faster than i was making them, it was inevitable that i would run out in august. so i had to make a decision on whether to continue making 2 a week and drastically reduce the vine upload schedule to 2 a week, or start actually making 7 new ones per week. i decided to do a lot of jingle based videos, and i started by singing about the situation at hand

020405.question: hi Sam! quick question. you talked in one of the earlier questions about using a sophisticated hierarchical randomness in your method to produce your work, like using somewhere a random number generator to choose what to do. could you explain it in more detail (how the hierarchy works), and why you needed this to be productive for yourself?
020405.answer: that's not my name but whatever i've used it for different things, and it works differently depending on what i'm using it for. but the main reason i use it is to help make decisions when i know that any decision would be right. one of the most important things i've learned is you can really make something out of anything. this is one of the most important things that i've realized, and it applies to songwriting, making videos, anything. and it's great news to realize this, but if you are also responsible for choosing what thing to do, it often undermines your confidence. think of it this way: the great news is you can make any piece of trash into something great. sounds exciting, right? but what if you're allowed to choose which piece of trash to use? you won't be able to think clearly. because part of the reason it works is because you know you have to be stuck with that thing, and you have to figure out how to make it good. if you're allowed to choose what thing to start with then you're just going to constantly question if you're working on the right thing and you're going to get cold feet on every project immediately because you're not sure if it's the right project, and you won't have any brain power left to actually figure out what to do on the project because you will be busy second guessing whether it's the right project. so that's why it helps to get all your choices into a list and make a firm plan to do whatever project is decided by the randomizer. one of the main places i've used this is when picking what songs to record. i've written hundreds of songs throughout the years, and there are so many left to be recorded. so usually when i put out a song i pick from this list. every song has tiny reasons why i think "oh that's the wrong song for right now" but if you have that attitude you're never going to be comfortable picking a song. i always try to 'actually choose the right one' but my confidence in the decision collapses every time, and i have to randomize. as a result i have recorded some songs that i probably never would have chosen otherwise, but i was able to make them into something good because i wasn't questioning the entire decision while trying to make the thing. i think a lot of artists use randomization in various ways when they feel there are too many choices. i also often get a random word suggestion as a starting point for writing tweets

020417.question: This analysis of your latest video was posted in the comment section by shredup chopel, what do you think of it? Is it close to the idea you had in mind when writing the video? Analysis: Part 1: play by play The video opens up with our protagonist "Steve" introducing himself. The very next thing he tells us is that he drives a car thats stuck in a tree. He then goes on to admit he was lying and that his real name isn't steve. he then says that he's filing for an extension on his taxes because he didn't pay them but in the same sentence says doesn't plan to do them. Why? Because "thats the way he likes to live his life and he feels like everything's gonna be fine". The day ends. The next day he tells the viewer that hes skipping work again, implying he does it frequently, but clarifies that its because hes unemployed. The mailman delivers mail but he adds the details that he was late and wa s actual ly a woman. She then breaks into the same jingle steve did earlier saying "thats the way i like to live my life..." . All of a sudden theres a change of scenery and he starts talking about mountains that we can see are right behind his house yet he says "I don't remember why i first saw the mountains". He then says that they've ALWAYS been there. He wonders why they're there but whether he knows or not he has to accept that they're there. He says that he can't claim them. Then he does a complete 180 and states that he can and does so very quickly. He then starts the jingle from before. "Thats the way i like to live my life.." but he gets cut off right as he starts, its another mail delivery. This time the person delivering it is a bird but he doesn't mention anything about it nor does he mention anything about the mail being delivered straight to him rather then to his house. The mailman doesn't break into a jingle this time, only saying "heres the mail." The letter is adres sed to s teve despite that not being his name, which he points out, and it asks how he climbed the mountain. Steve says he glad the person asked and gives a simple answer saying that its a simple two step process, first find the mountain, then climb it. After this steve breaks into the last jingle of the video but this time he says "Thats the way we can get things done and thats how I do it, its easy and simple cause you know what to do." Steve stands there smiling when a downpour starts but steve doesn't react at all simply standing there and smiling. A 5 day weather forecast pops up on screen showing nothing but rain for each day and it moves rapidly showing rain for many more days then 5. Steve then says "bye i'm steve" despite saying it wasn't his name earlier and the screen cuts to black. Part 2: Breakdown of Steve This is obviously a very confusing story. The main character "steve" makes many contradictory and strange statements and bizarre things ha ppen wit h no explanation. To fully understand this we need to look at the story part by part then look at the big picture. First of all why does steve introduce himself as steve and then say thats not actually his name? The character steve seems to represent many things throughout the story, at times he operates the same as any normal person, or character in a story might but at other times he does very strange things. He changes his identity and says things that are impossible such as him driving a car in a tree, theres also a point where a talking bird delivers him mail. Steve doesn't pay taxes and doesn't have a job, He's also secluded from others in the mountains. These traits are indicative of multiple personality disorder and schizophrenia. The viewer isn't a character in the story but he talks to the viewer, rather then just narrating whats happening I think steve is talking to himself and the viewer is seeing whats happening through his eyes, this is why we saw the bird talk ing. The first real thing does in the story is file for an extension on his tax returns and then say he wont ever be paying them. Although this statement may seem like he doesn't plan to pay what he owes, I think whats actually happening is steve doesn't owe anything at all. Steve doesn't appear to live in a city but rather a rural area with mountains so it may be either he is excused from paying taxes because of his mental ailments or the government of his country doesn't require its citizens to pay taxes. Part 3: breakdown of events First, Either way the point of him filing for an extension is pointless, he also says he doesn't have a job. steve appears to live a life without a goal. He's secluded in the mountains and his mental afflictions may prevent him from growing or working towards something meaningful. His random bursts into jingles show how childlike his mental state is and the flashing colors show his warped views of reality. Despite this he t hinks ev erything is going to be ok and his more or less happy with himself. One day the mailman delivers the mail and this is when he starts to say something rational although pointless and unneeded. He says the mailman was actually a woman and was late, despite this statement being unneeded it makes sense and theres no indication of it being false. Yet when the mailman comes she also bursts into the same jingle steve was doing. The mailman may have similar mental issues to steve and the two of them are just role-playing, She isn't dressed like a mailman and its never said that she delivers anything to steve, simply dances and leaves. She also doesn't identify herself as a mailman but steve does, maybe its because she did deliver something to steve without him realizing. Steve might have just imagined the mailman doing the jingle as well. I think the two most important things here are that first of all the mailman was late, in the way that steve is late to life. As a fully grown adu lt he st ill acts like a kid but the mailman "delivered" something to him, a doctor delivering medicine. Steve gains newfound clarity and sees the mountains behind him. The mountains are his mental problems, the things he can't do becase of his mental condition. He doesn't know why he first saw them, he wasn't aware that he was being medicated but they've always been there, just like his mental issues. He feels like he'll never be able to climb them but after the delivery he is able to right away. The medicine is working. As soon as he reaches the top he tries to do his jingle but he can't, he's no longer happy. Theres another delivery but the person delivering it is a bird. This could be steves issues presenting themselves once again, but he doesn't say anything. The medication didn't solve the underlying problems but merely allowed him to hide them, this is why he sees a bird but makes no comment. To someone not seeing it through steves eyes he would seem normal. This is shown again when hes called steve and despite him not thinking that its his name he just says "whatever" and goes along with it, he doesn't know he's steve but he just hides the fact he thinks he isn't. He starts being interviewed about how he solved his mental issues, maybe by a doctor or family member. He gives a very simple answer that isn't very helpful at all because he doesn't know how he climbed the mountain and his issues are still there, they just went up the mountain with him but he keeps up the image of being a normal person. he does a jingle but its different this time, theres no mention of him being alright or happy he just says that he solved his problems. His issues are never solved until the end. The rain starts and steve just keeps standing there and smiling despite the heavy downpour and he doesn't go into a jingle or say anything and the weather forecast shows never ending rain. Steve is depressed. The medication is making him a depressed mess keeping his schizoph renia and mpd inside but he's no longer happy. Everntually steve accepts that this wont change. He says "Bye i'm steve" showing that he's lost who he truly is, he doesn't make an effort to find the happy person he was before by saying hes not actually steve and kills himself. This is a dark commentary on how the mentally ill live in todays society and the overmedication not being an answer. Steve was fine before anyone decided his pointless life wasn't ok and after they decided they fixed him steve lost the person he was when he was happy and can no longer bear his own life.﻿
020417.answer: shockingly sad. i didn't think i could possibly read something so sad absolutely not. this analysis is sadder than anything i could have imagined "filing for an extension on my taxes" i thought was a nice line for that point in the video because it was a nice contrast to the much simpler items that come before it (drive a car, in a tree, what's your name, that type of stuff.) it was fun to jump to something much more 'grownup' and verbose. but the line also has a twist at the end because he says he's never going to pay the taxes. which i thought was a fun idea because if he's not going to pay them, then why is he filing for an extention, right this is almost an identical strategy to the taxes line. i'm skipping work again today (which seemed neat because it implies that you skip work a lot, so shouldn't you have been fired by now?) but adding "because i don't have a job" i just thought was a nice twist. steve is unpredictable. i wouldn't jump to conclusions. also there is a large goal coming up just a few seconds later which spoiler alert he achieves that's not necessarily true yet at this point in the video the flashing colors are not necessarily seen by steve, they are seen by the viewer. and the music is not necessarily something that steve is actually doing or taking part in, it is just a device for the viewer. think of theatrical musical productions. the characters break into song, but are we really expected to believe that the characters spontaneously sing songs that seem pre writen, about their lives, and it is already fully rehearsed and harmonized with multiple characters taking part, AND with musical accompaniment coming from seemingly nowhere? this first jingle takes it to an emotional level for the first time, i think at the right time. it reflects emotionally on what happened, for the first time. whereas the previous events (car, tree, etc) might lead you to think this story is just going to be a series of him telling you 'then i this, then i that.' but after about the 3rd or 4th thing i think it's important to stop for a minute to sing a simple song of human emotion, optimism, and reflection upon the events. sure it's a bit careless because we're kind of neglecting the tax situation, but that's not the strangest thing that's happened so far, in fact this first jingle seems to be the first bit with no new information, which in itself makes it feel new in that regard, because as i said we are getting to an emotionally reflective level on previous events, for the first time, without piling on new events emotionlessly. that's not true. it is implied that she delivers the mail every day, like most mail carriers do. the point of this scene (next day, mailman, etc) is to generally keep the ball rolling on the new information and situations, and to continue to keep you guessing as to what is going on. we've already set the stage in 'verse 1' with the name, car, tree and stuff, now the idea is to sort of continue the game. the point of the 'woman' line is, again, we're adding a twist to the end of the line. like the end of the taxes line, or the end of the skipping work line. the idea of a mailman who is a woman seems fun to me because the word 'mailman' sounds like it's a man. but it's actually a woman. and i just thought it was an interesting place to reveal someone's gender. right. i figured it was a nice time to go back into that jingle, because it is almost sooner than you would expect, but it is familiar, so things don't get too crazy just yet. and the twist here is, it almost sounds as though she's singing about her gender, almost as if she chose to be that gender. i figured this was probably a nice touch, because gender freedom is something that i think we've all been thinking about more and more these days. but again it's not totally clear why she is singing it. it is left slightly up in the air, which again i think is a nice strategy especially for a video like this where you are never quite sure what the heck is going on. i was planning on giving her some kind of postal uniform, but she looked better wearing the same type of clothes as steve. no one really knows why paper mail carriers are there anymore. nowadays we mostly use email for everything. which is another reason why 'mailman' seems like a fun idea. everyone knows what it is, and it seems familiar, yet in the back of your mind, what are they really doing? it's just a person who visits your house every day. which seems nice that is not necessarily true that's not true at all. if she were delivering medicine i would have used an icon that looked more like medicine, not envelopes. also this is off the subject but i just realized you did not notice that steve's house does not have a door. the point of the mountains is to add a new larger twist to the feel of the video. we've already gone through some 'daily' sounding sort of riff raff (cars, names, mail, paperwork, etc.) and we've also seen the same jingle twice, so it almost feels like we're in a pattern. so time for something bigger, different, at a different pace. the mountains scene is at a much slower pace, much more of an ominous, deep feeling. that's the most unexpectedly dismal analysis i could possibly imagine i tried to put some very subtle and peculiar inconsistencies in the way the grammar is phrased here. you might think it should say 'suddenly i saw the mountains which i had never noticed becore, and i don't remember them being there.' but it's different to say ' i don't remember Why i first saw them.' basically i'm taking common phrases but turning them around just a little bit in ways that i haven't quite heard before, but they feel the same. there was no delivery. steve's house doesn't have a door. right. again, using pacing and timing here. after a long ominous segment about the mountains seeming impenetrable and immoveable, downright unclimbable, we suddenly kill the music and ominous tones and unexpectedly we can climb the mountains. what's more is, i used present tense for both. so it's not even like 'i couldn't climb them, but now i can' it's an even more sudden switch than that, 'i can't climb them but i can' it's most like a quantum mechanical paradox. and it's off to the races, we jump back into the jingle because that's what you might expect, but usually it's a good practice to stay one step ahead of the audience. they already get the idea. so there is an interruption immediately medicine is a fun sounding and interesting concept, like mail, cars, or trees. it is likely that this video Could have had scenes about medicine, maybe if it continued, or if i wrote another similar video. if i wanted to use the idea of medicine, i would do it in a way that actually mentions it, because i do think it is a fun thing to mention. i have done other videos and tweets which mention the idea. i would not do it in a secret and dark way, that is not my idea of a good time that's ridiculous. the reason this jingle stopped is clearly an interruption from the mailbird. and it's very casual in nature. there is no indication that steve is disappointed by being interrupted. it's very casual. it's just another surprise, intertwined with something familiar (the mail). the surprise is that there is mail on the top of the mountain, and how did it come so quickly, how did anyone know steve was up there, etc etc etc. and it's a bird because why not. also i have no idea what kind of bird that is. some people said it was a kiwi but i just made something up. the script said it was actually supposed to be a penguin, but i was working off phone timers to get this thing done (video making takes a long time, you gotta stay on top of the time) so i just drew the fastest thing i could. turned out to probably not be a penguin. there is no medication in this video but i have noticed that there is a lot of medication in this analysis. again, just trying to keep it interesting. sure the mailman is a bird and it's on top of a mountain etc etc, but this is all part of the counter-swing of the pendulum from the slow, deep segment before about the mountain. from the suddenly climbing the mountain, it's light quick jumps, and before you know it we're reading a letter, and it's suddenly a q&a video, which at this point seems appropriate because what the fuck is happening so far in this video, it's about time we start taking some questions. this part was fun, because it was an excuse to bring back the name ambiguity. obviously the letter should say 'dear steve' because you naturally think this guy's name is steve, because the video is called 'hi i'm steve' with him in the picture, and the first thing that happens in the video is you see the guy tell you his name is steve. so honestly even i forgot his name wasn't steve, until i said it ("dear steve") and then i instantly realized the fun built-in opportunity to reference the name ambiguity here, which sort of anchors that as a recurring theme. also gives steve a chance to mug to the camera which i thought was neat. was very careful on the facial expression here so as to not seem too mad nor too happy. just kind of shrugging it off. that's not true, he is asked what i think is a very obvious question, how did he climb this mountain which he seemingly just climbed in 2 seconds. that question seemed to be the most important and relevant question at that time in the video. there are other questions, but that seemed especially relevant because it is about something very large that just happened moments ago. (also another added twist is how did someone ask this via postal mail so quickly) i think the more important part of this section is the part just before he gives the explanation. he looks in the air for a minute, and i feel like we're really not sure what tone this video is going to take. honestly the "well i'm glad you asked that" is something that's been lingering in my head for a long time, there is a music video for a 1988 song called 'da butt', and in the intro to the video, spike lee is interviewed and he answers the question starting just like that 'well i'm glad you asked that' in a very similar tone and i just thought it was great. so that type of tone on that line has been stuck in my head for a while now. and as for the 2 step program, i think a detailed setup with bluntly simple contents is always a nice device i think, i have done it in a lot of my videos, and i have always fallen in love with it seeing it other places. (there is a tweet somewhere, not mine, that says "parts of the worm" and listed underneath it just says "worm.") it's just a fun device, set things up formally and yet have the contents be way more simple than you expected it. And, getting metaphorical about the mountains, let's say it does represent challenges and obstacles (which i think it does) sometimes there is really no good explanation for solving them. you just do it. but actually now that i think about it, this 2 step program is very important because a lot of people miss the first step. identifying the problem is so incredibly important and solving it actually gets surprisingly easier when you just identify the problem! so actually i wholeheartedly believe in that explanation. yes, it's time for another jingle! and let's do a different one this time because we've already surely exhausted the other one. i think the music sounds very, very happy. he's also smiling and dancing. and the lyrics to the jingle are very happy. this part of the video screams happiness with flying colors, but i respect your opinion that's not quite what it says, it is more of a conclusion to his quick lesson. this is a general celebration that problem solving is possible. yikes, i am starting to wish i never read this analysis. so depressing. ok so after this 3rd jingle, there really is a sense of conclusion to this video, it seems like everything that's gonna happen has happened. we've used words, music, together in all the fun usual ways that i like to use them in videos. so what else can be done? well, weather speaks very loudly, at least to me, especially rain. basically the entire video up until this point has been full of words and music, the only thing left to do was rain. no words, no music. it was probably just about the last twist that i could have gotten mileage out of. it feels like stepping out of the paradigm of the video, again because no words no music. this is just what rain actually sounds like in real life. and again, i think it still keeps you guessing about what is going to happen next. the length of this section is really sort of the 'big finish' of the video. like i said, it feels complete at this point, so we go heavy on the rain, dragging out the time (even showing a weather graphic that further represents this time drag, showing endless rain in the future) and wrap it up! given that this line is almost exactly the same as the first line of the video, it seems hard to argue that we're "lost." seems more charactaristic of something being "found." ...A couple of nice bonuses i found in the last line, 1. it sounds exactly like the first line (hi/bye rhymes) 2. you don't normally introduce yourself when you leave, which makes for an interesting sounding phrase that you don't hear too often, and 3. adding further controversy to the name issue, as if he just admitted his name was steve? either way it's nice closure because he said that at the beginning as well. i wish i never read this i can't believe i responded to this. this is terrible

020434.question: For someone who isn't too keen on music theory (you said people should use their "ears and spirits" instead).... you sure do seem to know a lot about it. Are you saying your "technical" knowledge of music theory hasn't helped you?

020578.question: Hey bill, I asked the question about 1/4 time signatures yesterday (7/10).. you're right that a 1/4 time signature would make each measure only have 1 beat.. but what I mean is, why even break a song up into measures, grouping beats together into 3 or 4 (or whatever) instead of just letting each beat stand alone? I know you can write a song in multiple time signatures anyways.. but I say cut out the middle man, just think tempo/pulse of individual beats instead of grouping beats together.
020578.answer: yes, but the majority of all music has a habit of falling into groups of 2, 4, 8, 16, etc. by putting bar lines around 4 beats, and also putting 4 bars per line on the page, it makes it way way easier to read. it's like using periods between sentences, or spaces between words

020601.question: why dont you use uppercase letters in your writing?

020602.question: this isn't a question but I'm a big fan and I think your work is interesting and thought provoking. Okay kind of a question: doesn't it get tiring when people are constantly telling you "you really ought to do X to be more successful"?? I bet it does. You shouldn't listen to those people. You got here without their advice, and you'll keep going without it too.
020602.answer: oh hell yeah ah, i see what you mean

020603.question: Do you usually prefer to use universal/cultural symbols, do you like to develop your own, or what balance between?

020604.question: I know its Tuesday but can you give me (or us) a Monday Trivia Question? It's weird because I asked you a question, and you might as me (or us) a question back.
020604.answer: have you seen all the monday videos yet

020605.question: You often respond to the "why don't you do this" questions by "it would take time and you wouldn't want to wait". Is it really important for you that fans don't wait? Or are you mostly happy when doing videos and music and wouldn't enjoy doing other stuff?
020605.answer: i am simply pointing out that the thing they want might not be what they want

020606.question: Can we expect more videos from you, now that you've finished your 20 minutes masterpiece?
020606.answer: yes, i have already made 1 since then. have you seen it yet

020607.question: Hey Bill. I just wanted to ask if when will you have more videos posted. Are you on a schedule? Are you busy? There's no rush I'm just curious because I LOVE all your videos short and or long!

020608.question: will you ever make a discord server?
020608.answer: i already have one. but i don't really know what to do with it

020609.question: What is your opinion on wearing a toast costume in public?

020610.question: how do you know if you were actually a bad guy this whole time

020611.question: youve got a lot of nifty answers for scary questions but what if youre wrong. doesnt that bother you to think about

020612.question: what is more satisfying than a really good high five? the answer is nothing. dont answer this i already did

020613.question: coins. love em or hate em, right?

020614.question: do you ever feel that one day youre gonna get sick of making things
020614.answer: maybe when i finish making them

020615.question: what's one thing most people are wrong about
020615.answer: "the definition of insanity is doing the same thing again and expecting different results." that's not the definition of insanity. it's a very popular quote, but it's not the definition of insanity. it's the definition of perseverence and persistence, phrased in a slightly negative way to make it sound more shameful. seems to be some kind of twisted propaganda campaign to teach you that perseverence is insane

020616.question: how solipsistic are you on a scale of 1 to 1

020617.question: im boooooored..... What can i do?

020619.question: Why you never put caps on the start of your answers ?
020619.answer: seems like a waste of time, and it doesn't make it any easier to read. just makes me seem like some kind of congressperson or something

020620.question: But Bill, while I understand the frustration of not being able to release content fast enough, won't it be frustrating if, say certain people started making music videos for your songs or designing your merchandise, they didn't properly make the content even nearly how you want it?
020620.answer: that is completely true and that is always the reason i do everything myself. but i need to be open to clever possibilities. like getting help with things other than that

020621.question: uppercase letters are for suckers amirite
020621.answer: i think they are helpful, and useful

020622.question: how did you avoid second-product syndrome when making "history of the entire world"? i'm assuming you probably didn't expect "history of japan" to go viral, and "history of the entire world" is so similar to japan in terms of structure and humor and overall feeling. both videos are obviously incredibly similar, and yet so different from each other. how did you create a spiritual sequel to japan without essentially making the same video?
020622.answer: make it totally ridiculous the secret was to think of history of japan as the prequel, even though nobody believed me

020623.question: Hey Bill. I've been a fan of your work since history of Japan and I was wondering if you were going to resume your short fun vids or plan on doing another documentary.
020623.answer: how about something of a more medium size

020624.question: were you surprised at the jokes ppl latched onto in hotewig? or do u not really care?
020624.answer: it is exactly the same as what happened with history of japan, and the the short videos on vine before that

020625.question: will there ever be a return of the bill wurtz band?

020626.question: how do i incorporate more mischief into my harmony singing?? i can sing good harmonies but they're not great. it always seems like they're just nice and not like spirit-filled. i think i am using my ears and spirit but i feel like i'm blocked from getting to the really good stuff. on second thought this applies to all my musical pursuits, what can i do? have you ever felt like this?
020626.answer: have you ever heard anything that you think makes you feel the way you are talking about? if so, first just learn what the heck they did. then the next time it happens, learn that too, i guess. before you know it you'll be an expert

020627.question: what music artist is your favorite
020627.answer: i like the unique qualities of each one

020628.question: Do you ever omit questions from the below log for any reason? If so, what kind of questions do you 'censor'?
020628.answer: yes it doesn't matter. the main reason i don't answer all the questions is because then i would be spending 24 hours a day doing questions, and then there would be nothing for people to ask about

020629.question: is it nice to answer each question?

020630.question: "i'm assuming you probably didn't expect 'history of japan' to go viral" yeah right. this is gotta be bullshit, right? you probably expected a large response.
020630.answer: i thought that a large response was a reasonable possibility. but you can never guarantee these things

020631.question: Why do you answer off the wall questions that are constructed on purposes just to get a reaction or agitated response from you and not answer normal questions like mine?
020631.answer: i answer a wide variety of different types of questions. i also do not have time to answer nearly all the questions. i'm not sure if that answers your question

020633.question: why dont you post on your patreon. cant you make more money if you offer awards or add tiers
020633.answer: but what about all the people who can't donate, who might feel sad and left out, because people in a higher income bracket can afford more content than them

020635.question: do you have either a download link or an iTunes page for your music? it sounds great, btw!

020636.question: You say 'we' in a lot of your reality videos, yet you do everything yourself, who else makes up the we?

020637.question: Do you sometimes put symbols in videos because fuck it, but then everyone questions you about it because of the expectation it's some sort of metaphor even though it's just a fuck it decision
020637.answer: when making a video, you can put anything you want. you can even put apples in a video. i'm not sure if that answers your quesiton

020638.question: If you became a school principal, what would you do first?
020638.answer: get some sweater vests, i suppose

020639.question: why are some of your old videos (not so hard to do, this is my foot, etc.) not on youtube
020639.answer: back then i only had about 5 videos up there. (stupid music, bears, die, etc.). 'not so hard to do' was just bringing the collection down. i just didn't like it. i think i would have been more comfortable putting it there if there had been more other videos there. and i took down the 'foot' video because the suggested video images that popped up on screen afterwords were horrifying. they were all like insane foot diseases etc. it was very overwhelming, and they came up instantly after my video. it was just too much. i normally don't pay attention to that sort of thing, but this was right when i was first using youtube and i was pretty uncomfortable with that, especially because i was used to putting the videos on my own site, where they can live in peace

020640.question: Are you interested in history?
020640.answer: normally yes, but i recently spent 11 months doing more history than i could ever imagine and i really need to get away from it right now

020641.question: how come you didnt make a video for your patreon?
020641.answer: i prefer to make videos to put in places where they can be viewed by anyone, regardless of their income bracket

020642.question: since you have an /other.html page and an /otherother.html page, i would assume you would have a secret /otherotherother.html page. why dont you?
020642.answer: because all the site categories currently fit neatly into 3 pages. although there may be more categories in the future, which may require more pages. i hope that makes sense

020643.question: how do you manage to be crisp and concise
020643.answer: there is a trap that i often fall into where i go overboard and make things way too detailed. each time i fall into that trap, i say 'oh darn, fell into that trap.' because of the large amount of questions i've received, i've gotten a lot of practice figuring out ways to avoid falling into the trap, and each time i get a little bit more insight as to how to avoid it in the future. oh darn, just fell into the trap

020644.question: why do your songs always fade out in the end?
020644.answer: most of them do not, but i respect your opinion

020645.question: what's your idea of a good time?
020645.answer: it is difficult to predict, until it happens

020646.question: Why don't you make many monday videos anymore?
020646.answer: to devote more time to longer videos

020647.question: If I'm writing out a score to a song, how do I know if I should make it 6/8 vs 3/4 time? (Does it even matter?) I know, traditionally, 6/8 almost has a 2/4 feel with two "pulses" per bar (ONE two three FOUR five six) and 3/4 usually has the three distinct "pulses".. but the rhythm for this particular song doesn't have 2 pulses or 3 pulses uniformly in every single measure.
020647.answer: if i could hear it i could make an evaluation.

020648.question: whats your favorite element in the periodic table?

020649.question: is waxing a piano better than shaving it?

020650.question: have you had an existential crisis lately?

020652.answer: sure. at this point i have decided to design the merch myself and it is actually pretty exciting. but it is always good to hear from people that are willing to help, not with that but with anything. although i am so sorry if i don't get a chance to respond to everybody don't be mad at me

020654.question: Have you ever thought about how weird alligators are? They're giant lizards that swim and kill people. Freaky shit, man.
020654.answer: ah, i see what you mean

020655.question: What are your goals with your content?
020655.answer: have my thoughts and ideas seen and heard by other people, besides me

020656.question: what is your favourite word in the english dictionary?
020656.answer: dictionary (it is usually on the front cover)

020657.question: why do you call tennis shoes sneakers
020657.answer: i think sneakers are called sneakers because they are much quieter than most shoes that existed before

020658.question: How did you feel when you completed hotewig?

020659.question: What would you say to people that dislike your videos?
020659.answer: nothing. it is more important that i spend time making the videos (and music, etc) instead

020660.question: hi, have you figured out what the fuck is going on yet
020660.answer: i am still doing some experiments

020661.question: homosexuals are pretty gay am I right

020663.question: Is the monday video list which can only be found via the questions page or via guessing its URL supposed to be a teaser for an upcoming "other other other" page?
020663.answer: the monday page was made a long time ago, and i have only ever linked to it when people ask

020664.question: so i always ask questions and forget to check back later to see your answer and then forget what i asked in the first place, recommendations

020665.question: have you ever considered doing soundtracks for nature documentaries and the like? i feel like your musical style and the visuals would work well together
020665.answer: i like it better when i can make the video part of the video as well

020666.question: What is your take on being alive?
020666.answer: it is cool you can do stuff

020667.question: What are suspended chords and how do they work?
020667.answer: so you know a C major chord is notes c, e, g. ok but now play 'f' instead of 'e'. so it's c,f,g. that is Csus, or you can call it Csus4. now trying playing Csus4, then C major. nice

020668.question: Do you ever have inspiration, go to write it down, then forget and do nothing for the rest of the day?
020668.answer: i have a system of logging ideas. doing the work is not always related to coming up with the original ideas. coming up with ideas often does not put you in the mood to work, it often just puts you in the mood to come up with more ideas. so it's very important to catch all the ideas and get them all in one place so that when it's time to work, you have stuff to work on. the only problem is figuring out which one to pick, but that's a story for another time

020669.question: What are your thoughts on the Oxford Comma? The Harvard Comma? The Yale Comma? The Cornell Comma? The Columbia Comma? The Pennsylvania Comma? The Princeton Comma? The Dartmouth Comma? Or the Brown Comma? What about the College Comma, or the IVY League Comma? What about Commas in general?
020669.answer: a comma is great if you feel like you need any kind of pause, or separation between words. but there are no exact rules on when to use it, even though everyone thinks their rules are the right ones

020670.question: working with other people sounds so anti-billwurtz though
020670.answer: ah, i agree. don't worry, it still doesn't work

020671.question: are you all by yourself or do you have a team behind you?

020673.question: Having a look at your script, I noticed that most of the most quotable parts of the History of Japan were not actually there. Did you decide to add them in later, or were these all last minute decisions?
020673.answer: the script posted is the version when the script was first completed. during the second phase where i was planning out the graphics, some rewrites occured, especially when i realized certain parts were logistically impossible and/or not good enough

020674.question: Hey bill, could you help me find the advantages and disadvantages to getting rid of money? Thanks :3
020674.answer: advantages is you don't have to buy stuff. disadvntage would be you can't sell stuff

020675.question: Why did you choose to make those recent "questions" that were just someone randomly swearing at you visible on this page?
020675.answer: i get a wide variety of different types of questions. i also post a wide variety of different types of questions. i'm not sure if that answers your question

020676.question: do you have fun making your videos
020676.answer: the most fun part is having the idea, and then having it be done. the process the only way to get there, and it's hard work ..... but there are a lot of fun things about it, if you have the right attitude. and it is important to have the right attitude also becuase it makes the product better

020677.question: what do you think about the analysis of how the steve video is about your life
020677.answer: i would say i agree with that, but after having read some of the analyses i will say that some of them are way more dismal and depressing than anything i could have imagined, so i don't want anyone to think my life is in any way associated with those types of analyses

020678.question: what would your requirements be for someone to help you work?
020678.answer: the main thing is i have to first get to know them enough to trust them. this may seem strange, but if you think about it it's not strange because in order to work with someone they are going to need to have access to a lot of unfinished work, etc etc. and i need to trust that they're not going to just leak everything all over the place

020679.question: Are there too many things nowadays? or are there not enough things?
020679.answer: any amount of things is just the right amount of things

020680.question: what is your favourite part about making videos?
020680.answer: the part where i get to think of something and have it appear in someone else's mind

020681.question: i'm a big fan of your "penis" and "vagina" videos. if i might ask, what was your inspiration for making them?
020681.answer: basically just doing screen tests. honestly didn't really know how to make videos, was just seeing what was possible. those 2 were almost the exact technique as 'bears' or 'whatever', except 'bears' and 'whatever' were "music videos" meaning they were based on a song that i had already recorded before, where as 'penis' and 'vagina' were free videos, not based on a song just written as a video, with the music being made to fit the video

020682.question: on a scale of 1 to 10 whats your favorite color in the alphabet

020683.question: can you like my memes on instagram
020683.answer: i don't really know how to use instagram except to post

020684.question: Do you enjoy making youtube videos?
020684.answer: i prefer making videos outside of youtube. but youtube is very popular, so it is often advantageous to post them there, as well

020685.question: How did "Steve" get his car in a tree?
020685.answer: the same way he got the name "steve"

020687.question: How many questions have you been asked?
020687.answer: it's no longer possible to count them. but i know the number has 5 digits

020689.question: why don't you put all the "are you ... ?" - "i've never been tested" questions under one hyperlink?

020690.question: will you ever tweet back at ethan from h3h3productions? (context: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fBlR6_c7MKI&feature=youtu.be&t=1588)
020690.answer: i never use @tweets. for some reason i think that format of tweeting feels totally wrong for me and i have never used them, except for maybe in extreme circumstances. that's just my prefecence

020691.question: HEY. You should make actual music. That'd be GREAT because I really like your short songs, Thanks in advance if you noticed my existence.
020691.answer: my music is actual, but i respect your opinion if you like the short ones, then you can keep listening to the short ones! and keep ignoring all the long ones

020692.question: Will the 1st musical note of your next song or video be natural, sharp, or flat? Will the 1st chord be major, minor, diminished, augmented, or dominant?
020692.answer: the first note of the video is B, on a B major chord. unless i decide to do a different video, i'm sort of working on a few different things right now

020693.question: why does steve feel like everything's gonna be just fine but the mailman knows everything's gonna be just fine
020693.answer: it was necessary to change at least one word in the second jingle from the first. in the original draft, the second jingle was the same as the first, but "fine" was changed to "alright." but during production i changed it to "know" and "just fine." the progression "feel like" to "know" is nice because it seems like we're gaining confidence. this is the exact same sort of lyrical strategy you might use in songrwiting, when varying the second chorus a little bit from the first

020694.question: Why the robots.txt file? What did google's crawler do to deserve its banishment from your site?
020694.answer: post the fire hydrant note on the front page of a google search for my name

020695.question: how much is your content directly influenced by other viral content? I notice that "house building checklist" has a similarity to one of tomska's asdfmovies, while "Are You the Real You" seems related to dhmis4 - coincidence or not?
020695.answer: not at all i've never seen a tomska video, but i do know that he has been subscribed to me for a long time i've never heard of that channel coincidence or perhaps they were influenced by me

020696.question: yo bill man what's your mbti

020697.question: do you really enjoy making longer videos, or the reason why you do more of them now is because they get more recognition?
020697.answer: i'm just trying to be reasonable

020698.question: will you make more videos of medium size?

020699.question: Do you have all the answers?

020700.question: you mentioned that you break down a project into small tasks and do each of them in an assigned time frame. How do you know how much time is needed for each small task?
020700.answer: i don't remember saying that i don't

020701.question: why don't you allow ads on your videos? people who dont like ads will just use adblock so it won't bother anyone.
020701.answer: kills the vibe big time that's not true. not everyone uses ad block. maybe they don't know how. maybe it doesn't work on their system. maybe they had an old one that doesn't work for everything anymore. some people don't even know it exists. not everybody has that whole thing figured out, but i understand that you probably do

020702.question: why is the email written on your email page so big

020703.question: what keeps you from killing yourself?
020703.answer: all the stuff i still want to do

020704.question: Have you ever considered writing and recording something heavily multi-tracked/overdubbed and experimenting with multiple voices?
020704.answer: i usually like to use a quantity of instruments and voices that is "just right"

020705.question: So the paradox is, you need help in order to do all this crazy stuff quickly. But if major parts of it (the music, the visuals, the writing) aren't done by you then it's not Bill Wurtz Content anymore. Then it's a mish mash of your vision and some stranger's interpretation of your vision. So you can't have any major help, but it'd be super helpful to have major help, am I getting that right?
020705.answer: yes that is exactly right. it's almost as if we need to think outside the box to make this work

020706.question: What do you use your guitar for?

020707.question: Why do some of your older videos oscillate in video speed (e.g. rising out of bed, here's a bowl, my foot, etc.)?
020707.answer: using speed and time are important tools in my tool kit. i'm not sure if that answers your question

020708.question: If a banana was our form of currency would that make Africa one of the richest places ever and the rest of the non banana growers would be screwed?
020708.answer: no. Africa already does have many extremely valuable commodities and resources. and unfortunately what usually happens is it is taken from them by someone more financially and/or militarily powerful. in the old days by conquest, in more modern times perhaps via predatory loan

020709.question: If you were a billionare would you still be a youtuber
020709.answer: i prefer not to label people based on sites they may have used

020710.question: "and that's how I do it" that last "do it" is so satisfactory and I don't know why. I can play music on various instruments but I don't really know music theory. is there a reason why that part gives me that feeling?

020711.question: As a suggestion for the 7.12.17 12:52 pm person, I guess you can settle for 6/8 if you want one sig that encompasses everything. As in there are always 6 quaver beats in the bar but not necessarily grouped in 3 crotchets/quarter notes/whatever (ie 3/4). Essentially like a musical lowest common denominator if that makes sense?
020711.answer: that seems mathematically true, but in reality 6/8 is almost always grouped in 2 groups of 3. in reality 6/8 almost always means 2/1-and-a-half but that would be a mindfuck to write on a piece of paper. if it's 3 groups of 2 it almost always is written as 3/4. although there are many songs that borrow back and forth between the two feels. especially in west africa

020715.question: how would you call that section in "got to know what's going on" right before the last choruses? the bit that goes "open the door, cuz i got to know what we came here for, whatever it is i'll believe it". it doesn't "feel" like part of the bridge since it imitates the verse, chorus and prechorus sections. my best guess would be to call it a "summary" but that's not a musical term afaik
020715.answer: i just call it a 'quiet verse.' i've never found a better name for it. it specifically means the verse that occurs nearing the end of the song, after at least 2 choruses have happened and usually after the bridge if there is one. the dynamic drops low, it mimics the verse, and very often jumps back up to a high dynamic to usher into the last chorus(s). very standard technique. in this case we've used a half-length-verse, and also a half-length pre-chorus.

020716.question: i get sick of ideas i have and i no longer want to work on them just a few days after i start working on them. they're good ideas but i have more ideas and they're more fun to think about. but i still want those original ideas made?
020716.answer: ah, welcome to the waterfall. after enjoying that free-falling feeling of helplessly falling into the abyss for quite a while, suddenly you will remember that with a little organization, you can easily separate this into 2 distinct job titles. one where you just write down and log the new ideas as they occur, like a bolt of lightening, try to get down as much as you can in the moment, (this may happen anywhere! at the mall, at the zoo, remember to keep small tools on hand to be able to catch these ideas at any time. in todays day in age i recommend a smart phone, etc). And then, at another time, in another suit, at another desk, as a different employee, you will get down to work in a nice, quiet place. Which idea the 'worker' chooses to work on will have nothing to do with which idea was created first, or last, or anything else. There will need to be another decision system that chooses which idea to do when. and i don't know what the best way is, that is something you will have to manage within the company as a whole. but if all else fails, computer aided random number selection does work. So actually there is 3 job titles. the dreamer (idea creator) the worker (who works on the idea) and the manager, who SOMEHOW has to decide what idea to work on. i think it is very important that the worker and the manager do not play the same role at the same time-- the worker needs to never question the authority of the decision to work on the project at hand, or else they will not be able to focus on making that project the best it can be. the manager needs to make that decision, and then tell the worker what the project is.

020951.question: Why do the versions of your videos on this site use a resolution of 1136 x 639, while they are 1080p on YouTube?
020951.answer: because at the time that i started making videos regularly, that was the size that automatically fit on the screen on the computer / web browser that i was using. 1280x720 (or larger) would go off the screen by default, and require clicking extra buttons to see the whole thing. actually, this is still the case on my current computer / browser. Another reason to keep the file sizes low on the site is because i do not use streaming on the site. smaller files means faster load time. if you prefer a streaming experience you can always use youtube, but i prefer to actually load the files because then you can pause/unpause (to discover those dank secrets!) and just really horse around with the play slider, which is generally a must-have for me when i watch videos. it's what drives me crazy about watching on youtube, you really can't manipulate the playback nearly as readily as i would prefer

020978.question: Regarding the 7.19.17 6:32AM question about what defines a chord... you can give a group of notes many different names, the main thing is to look at the context. What chord comes before it, what comes after? What notes are the other instruments/singer playing at the same time you're playing your chord (the bass player has the power to change a lot of chords if he/she wants to and the "melody instrument" can add extensions). It doesn't really matter what name you give the chord, but if you're writing a piece of sheet music or something.. I'd give it the name that I think makes the most sense in the full context of the song.
020978.answer: ah, that's seems reasonable, and downright sensible

020987.question: What do you think about dark matter/dark energy? Is it actually a real thing that exists or is it just something that Math People made up to make their equations and stuff work out?

021015.question: Hey Bill I just saw on instagram that you use a very old version of Final Cut. I think you should switch to the pro X version because the magnetic time alone will save you a ton of time on your videos (you can also disable it when need be). I think you will also be able to transfer your current graphics to the new version of final cut. All this should enable you to finish something like the Japan video in 1 month. Although it may seem uncomfortable I believe that it is an absolute necessary step if you want to continue making longer videos within a reasonable amount of time. I am not an editing expert so I cannot offer you a tutorial. But if the tutorials on youtube don't help I'm sure one of your fans would be willing to help you over email on a step by step basis if you like. Would you be willing to consider it?
021015.answer: it is important to remember that on history of japan, more than 1 month was spent on things outside of the program you mentioned. it is upsetting to me when people think they have any idea what goes on in the process, and make assumptions about what takes which amount of time

021025.question: you replied to a question: "i can find the prime factorization of 6 digit numbers in my head" do you have a trick to do this? how would I find the prime factorization of 239429 in my head?
021025.answer: since it's already odd and doesn't have 5, check for 3. the check for 3 is if the digits add up to another multiple of 3. you can also do this by knocking off all multiples of 3 you see in the digits, even if it's multiple digits next to each other. so delete the 9s, delete the 3, and delete the "42". and you're left with 2 which is not a multiple of 3 so we've ruled out 3. Now you just start moving through the prime numbers, checking each one. there are many different tricks here, but it's generally the same strategies for every other prime from now on. let's say we're checking for 7 (the next prime to check for). see the 23, on the left? that's close to 21, so let's change that to 2. == 29429. what this means is, we just subtracted 210000 from the original number. so what this means is, if the original number is a multiple of 7, then 2949 has to be a multiple of 7 also because we just subtracted 210000 (which is clearly a multiple of 7). basically we manipulate the original number by multiples of 7, until it is simple enough to see whether the resulting number is a multiple of 7. and if it is, congratulations the original number was a multiple of 7 also. in the manipulations, you are allowed to add or subtract any multiple of 7, and you can also multiply or divide by anything you want. so from 29429, i can see "42" in there, so you can just replace that with zero 29009 (we just subtracted 420, which of course is a multiple of 7). now let's add 21 == 29030, knock off the zero at the end (you can divide this by 10 and it won't effect whether or not it's a mutiple of 7, so you can knock off zeros on the end all you want.) so 2903. now let's add 7 == 2910, knock off the zero = 291. (you can see the strategy, we're adding/subtracting small multiples of 7 based on whatever can even off the end to have a zero at the end, because then we can kill the zero and the number shrinks and still has its same status with regard to being a multiple of 7 or not.) so from 291, take off 21 is 270, knock off the zero is 27. which is clearly NOT a multiple of 7. basically i'm adding and subtracting multiples of seven to get the number simpler and simpler until eventually we can tell if the resulting number is a multiple of 7. and if you couldn't see whether 27 was a multiple of 7 then you could just knock off the 7 and it's 20, knock off the zero is 2. which is not a multple of 7. So congratulations, the original number (239429) is not a multiple of 7. Next we check for 11s. i would start with the left again, because 23 is so close to 22. replace it with 1 == 19429. then add 11 to the right,(and kill the zero) 1944. you can knock off 44, and pow, 19, not 11. so 11 is ruled out. Then start again for 13. from the left, change the 23 to 10 (effectively subtracting 130000), == 109429. '109' is 5 above 104 which i happen to know has 13 in it, so replace 109 with 5. == 5429. 54 is 2 above 52, which i happen to know has 13 in it, so 229. what's the nearest multiple of 13 above 229? 260. is that a multiple of 13 away? can't be because the only one in that century with 1 at the end of it is 91 and it's not 91 away (it's 31 away, again non-13.) so 13 is out. now check for 17. repeat this process through the primes, 17, 19, 23, 29, 31, etc etc. and you may be wondering "how far do i have to go before knowing if the original number is prime." well the answer is, if you are checking them all in order and you do it correctly, the process is guaranteed complete once you reach the square root of the original number. the way to loosely figure that out is, look at 250000. square root of that should be 5 with zeros ...500 times 500 should be 250000. so in this case if you check all the primes up to 500 and you don't find a match then you know you can stop. but if you find a match at let's say 31, then you divide the thing by 31 and then you have a much smaller number to work with, and find the primes there. then when you're done just include 31 as well. by the way i didn't check 31 in this example so 31 probably is not in there

021142.question: i don't understand the harmonic function of Sus chords. Seems to me like a chord that's dominant but cute, and like a shortcut to chords that leads to another colours. what do you think about it?
021142.answer: a good starting point to understanding sus chords is: play a C major triad (C, E, G). ok now play it with F note instead of E: (C, F, G). that is called Csus4. ok now play Csus4, then C. nice! Ok now also there is a rumor going around that if you use 2 instead of 4 (C,D,G) that is called Csus2, but that one doesn't really take as much pleaseure in the resolve as the Csus4 to C resolve. but it's still easier to say Csus2 than to say Cadd2no3. even quicker to just say C2, which is what i usually say. also you may have noticed that Csus4 can be the same as Fsus2, depending on whether the bass player is playing C or F. i'm not sure if that answers your question.

021150.question: Hey bill, thank you for answering my question. Your response made me seriously think about my current situation. At this point I am 20 and there is so much I want to prove, I want to grow beyond measures and make an impact in the animation industry (my life goal). I know I must resolve myself to this goal. Do you feel like you have to choose? Between a relationship with someone or working in solitude. I haven't received an assault of questions of when I am going to get married or settle down yet but I know in the few years I will. It's a suffocating feeling. I hope this isn't intrusive but did you go through something similar and what are you thoughts?
021150.answer: it's a classic situation for focused and hardworking artists (or any career) to find themselves in a relationship where the other person realizes that the artist needs to make their work the #1 priority. it is a very common story, but not the end of the world. it just means those types of relationships won't work. this is very very common, and it is also common for hardworking and focused artists to find relationships that work. usually when the other person has equally strong passions of their own, maybe different, maybe even the same one. i've seen this work plenty of times. but the failed relationship you're talking about is a classic story, and very common among people in your situation. i've been in one of those relationships as well. it's no big deal, you just learn why it doesn't work, and you both move on

021186.question: Have you noticed that there's not a lot of good words to rhyme with "love"? I can't keep writing about gloves and doves.. above is good, but it's weird using that if the rhyming scheme comes at the end of the phrase.
021186.answer: i think exact rhyming is kind of a myth, especially in music. not necessary, and sometimes not even the best choice. for 'love', 'of' is probably my best 'exact' choice, 'enough' is equally strong, then if we think outside the box a little, try 'one', 'none', 'done', ... i think if you try words with that sound as a rhyme for 'love', i think it will sound just fine. especially if you are making sure that the lines are something you want to say, not just something to try to force a rhyme. in music, as long as the vowel sound is the same, that's really all that matters. i actually think it often sounds better when the consonant sound at the end is a little different. it's kind of like when the daily speical is a little different than it was yesterday

021188.question: When people talk about the "downbeat" do they mean the 1 and 3 of each bar (in 4/4 time) with the 2 and 4 being the upbeat? Or is the downbeat the 1st eighth note and the second eightnote (or "the and" of the beat) the upbeat?
021188.answer: the downbeat usually means any of the 4 quarter notes (in 4/4 for example). the upbeat is the in between 8th note. the 2 and 4 can be called the 'backbeat' if there is a snare, clap, etc happening there. 1 and 3 would be the 'white beat' because that's when all the white people clap. god bless, they're trying their hardest

021271.question: Hey, I was thinkin bout music genres... I can't decide if they exist or not. I think there are distinct styles of music.. but just cause these styles exist doesn't mean that every band or artist can/should be categorized by these labels. There's plenty of music that blurs the lines, and plenty of music that doesn't really line up with any particular style. On the other hand though, there are a lot of bands/artists that do identify with a specific genre or style cause it has some kind of significance to them... I think there's musicians who are proud to say "I play blues music" or "I play punk rock" or "I play reggae" or whatever... what do you think? Are genres completely, 100% non-existant? Why or why not?
021271.answer: you can make music any way you want, there's infinite ways to make it. you can also make up names for things if you think that helps, sometimes it does. sometimes the whole point of creation is to evade those names. sometimes the names mean different things to different people, and they almost always change after 10 years. i'm not sure if that answers your question

021321.question: Are you always able to get the stream of music in your head out on paper or into your music program? I could never remember the parts that went before or how it led up to the current part and I feel a lot of my good ideas get wasted. It doesn't help that I'm also bad at piano. Is there another way?
021321.answer: it is very important to document new ideas immediately, otherwise you will forget. the reason you will forget is because it is brand new. you will seem to remember it perfectly in the moment, but as soon as you hear another song, the first one will be gone. you need to document new ideas immediately. nowadays there are audio recording devices everywhere, such as on smartphones, etc. just sing and/or explain how the thing goes

021393.question: today my priest told an anecdote in his sermon about how when he was a youth pastor he would make the youth play "mixer games" and one of them was where he would give an either/or option like "Batman or Superman" and each option had a side of the room, so (i guess, although it's left a little ambiguous:) whichever side you were "for" or "liked more," you'd go to that side. and I was immediately like: that's bullshit. chocolate or vanilla? well, first of all, it depends entirely on the application. i usually like chocolate ice cream and cake but i often like vanilla cake with vanilla frosting. but that doesn't even scratch the surface of all possible or even probable dessert options that could include chocolate or vanilla. this is assuming we're talking about Desserts That I Would Like To Eat Right Now and not, say, Desserts I Would Give My Enemy (i'd give him whichever he liked least in that application), or Paint Colors For My Bathroom, which given such a restricted choice I guess I'd have to go with vanilla. but like, what kind of fascist horseshit government am i living under that only allows brown and off-white (or maybe black, if you're talking about the actual color of a vanilla bean) as bathroom colors? after going through the other three examples of random dichotomies he gave my mind started itching from the inside and i realized that ten minutes had gone by and i'd missed half of an interesting sermon on predestination, which most people think is when God takes people's souls before they're born and puts them on either the Heaven side of the room or the Hell side of the room. (but i think his point was that it's not really like that.) and i didnt even think about "bill wurtz" until i was conscious of the brain itch but when i was i just smiled a little bit and thought i'd tell you about it.

021506.question: I was reading about how musicians use to get different effects and sounds from their instruments 'back in the day.' Some pretty cool stuff. In You Really Got Me, Ray Davies apparently used a razor blade to splice the speaker cone in his amp and poked pins into the cone. In Street Fighting Man, Keith Richards got an electric-guitar sound from an acoustic by using a tape cassette to record and overdub the parts and by playing right up to the mic. Link Wray used to poke holes in his speaker cone with pencils to get that fuzzy tone. You had all sorts of experimentation with reel to reel tape recorders to get echos and other weird effects. Lots of old blues guitarists would turn the gain and volume all the way up on lo-fi amps to the point of nearly blowing out the speakers to get their sounds. Sam Phillips (who produced a lot of those 50's rockabilly/rock 'n' roll records with Sun Records) would re-feed the playback from the recorder to the head, adjusti ng the s pace between the heads, tape speed and other stuff to make crazy echo and delay effects.... Today with all sorts of effects pedals, built in effects on amplifiers, digital recording sofwares where you can alter the sounds in so many different ways, do you think that these "proto-effects" or these old recording techniques are obsolete? When you're recording do you ever experiment with any of this type of stuff to create effects or different sounds, or do you it all on the computer, effects pedals, etc.?
021506.answer: sure, but there are new techniques. or you can use old techniques too if you want. maybe even use future techniques those techniques you mentioned never really made sense for me because i grew up in the digital age. but there are plenty of interesting rebellious "wrong" practices you can do in the digital age, or in any age. for example in the video "Are you the Real You" i decided to not actually crop out the screen fully on some of those text items, so some of the computer menus and window edges can actually be seen in the video. it was originally a mistake, but it adds character so i left it in. another crazy technique someone showed me many years ago was to open a picture in a text program (it looks like nonsense text) and start changing the letters. the picture glitches out in weird ways. i've never actually used that but that's another example of ways you can have fun in the post digital age

021508.question: I think that the reason people aren't noticing more inclusions in journals is because of a design discrepancy that I'm not too sure how to fix... a lot of people are used to this Scrolling Content Feed like on twitter or tumblr or facebook where people are almost being trained to smash the refresh button and develop a tunnel vision for the top most post at all times, so much that they lose all periphery in their content consumption habits... It's kinda tragic, but it's one of the reasons why I really like your site. I think some users are trying to force you into some kind of "Genre" of creator (whether it be your site or music or etc) so much that people seem to believe that you're trying to be irreverent, but all you do is just... *is*. Words kinda fail me there, and that's okay I think. People are looking at the pages that update "top-down" (as in "updates as you finish content" such as the music, videos, and most of the time the questions page) a nd autom atically assume that it applies to Literally Everything In The Entire World Ever All The Time Always when your notebook stuff is clearly labeled with a very definite Date Of Time, emphasizing Creation Chronology, but your site didn't exist forever so you come to this design dilemma for the content that was made Pre-Website: Emphasize Creation Chronology, or Update Chronology? Well, it's not really a dilemma, but it's more that people are too busy trying to see you in their terms as a creator so much that they're missing out on the actually new content. Something about not seeing the forest for the trees?
